Plot: A week in the lives of Nader and Stefano, two sixteen-year-old friends living in Ostia, on the Roman coast, between school, clubbing and robbing prostitutes. Nader is Egyptian, but was born in Rome. He is in love with Italian girl Brigitte and defies family wishes by running away from home. In order to defend his friend Stefano, he stabs a young Romanian and flees. Stalked, he goes into hiding, going as far as to sleep on the beach in the middle of winter. This brings him to start confronting his various contradictory identities. He feels Italian and wears blue contact lenses. He loves the world of consumerism and does not celebrate Ramadan. Yet he still manages to have extreme behaviours, like pulling the trigger on Stefano when he comes onto his sister, in order to defend her honour as a Muslim girl.

The title of the film refers to a 1962 poem by Pier Paolo Pasolini, called Prophecy, in which the great poet and director imagined a multi-ethnic world and the blue-eyed AlÃƒÂ¬s who would Ã¢â‚¬Å“destroy Rome.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ In GiovannesiÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s film, modern Pasolini-like adolescents move around RomeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s outskirts, but Nader doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t want to destroy anything, despite his worries.
